page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: In many ways the plantation of the trees has brought more wildlife to the forest. This area is thriving with small birds, birds of prey, rabbits, foxes and many other small mammals. The birds of prey are Kestrels, Barn owls, Little owls, Sparrow Hawks,and Buzzards who prey mostly on small mammals such as voles, mice, and young rabbits.There are lots of different small birds e.g. sparrows, chaffinch,and tits who mostly feed on berries. Roe Deer are most common and each year their numbers have to be checked by shooting. Their numbers tend to increase when the trees are cut down.
